title: A MYSTERIOUS MURDER IN THE MYSTERIOUS WOODS
description: Driving through the mysterious woods gave Deductive Logico the chills, but maybe that was because his AC was on full blast. Pretty soon, he had to pull over, partially to solve the murder of a hitchhiker, and partially because his car died.

suspects.name: COACH RASPBERRY
suspects.description: One of the best coaches this side of the Mississippi, regardless of which side you're on.

suspects.name: OFFICER COPPER
suspects.description: The best part of being a policewoman criminal is that you can cut out the middleman and fail to investigate your own crimes.

suspects.name: GRANDMASTER ROSE
suspects.description: A chess grand master who is always plotting his next move. Like how to bump off his next opponent! (1... e5)

weapons.name: A SHOVEL
weapons.description: A multi-use tool: kill someone and bury them with the same shovel!

weapons.name: A RITUAL DAGGER
weapons.description: It's made out of some ancient metal that Logico can't identify.

weapons.name: A POISONOUS SPIDER
weapons.description: Its unusual webbing shows it's not native to these woods.

locations.name: THE SKULL ROCK
locations.description: A rock that looks like a skull. Is it natural, or did someone carve it?

locations.name: THE ANCIENT RUINS
locations.description: Wherever these stones appear, you know somebody is getting murdered nearby.

locations.name: THE ONLY ROAD
locations.description: A twisting, winding, half-paved road through the woods.

clues: Logico caught a glimpse of the suspect with the shovel, but all he could see was that his eyes weren't blue.
A poisonous spider was not on the only road.

statements.speaker: Grandmaster Rose
statements.statement: You must study the moves of the pieces. For example, Officer Copper was at the skull rock!

statements.speaker: Coach Raspberry
statements.statement: Well, by golly, a shovel was at the ancient ruins.

statements.speaker: Officer Copper
statements.statement: My statement? I brought a poisonous spider.
